Description: Body sherd of South Ionian pottery little-master cup; interior: reserved; exterior: black at top of handle zone (though orientation is not certain); part-reserved and part-black plastic knuckle-bone (glaze carelessly applied); glazed black below; inscription on interior.
Type series: Schlotzhauer Ionian Cup Type with application
Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as belonging to the South Ionian little master cup Type and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9C. However, the curvature of the shoulder is consistent with his Type 9.B. For parallels regarding the shape and decoration, see See Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Samos 6.1, pl.42 no. 346). The inscription is unusual as these typically appear on the lip not the wall if they are placed on the inside of the vessel. The number A1283 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 290)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.762) (Phase 3)
